snippet: Joseph Ross, the owner of a Long Island insurance company, admitted his role in helping a longtime Jewish community leader steal from a social service organization.
abstract: Joseph Ross, owner of Long Island insurance company who was charged with helping Jewish community leader loot more than $7 million from one of New York City's most influential social service organization, pleads guilty; charges state that Ross's company, Century Coverage of Valley Stream, sent inflated invoices to Metropolitan New York Council on Jewish Poverty, with Ross pocketing at least $1 million himself.
lead_paragraph: Joseph Ross, the owner of a Long Island insurance company, admitted his role in helping a longtime Jewish community leader steal from a social service organization.

headline.main: Man Admits Role in Theft of $7 Million From Charity
headline.print_headline: Man Admits Role in Theft Of $7 Million From Charity

keywords.value: Metropolitan New York Council on Jewish Poverty
keywords.name: organizations
